info.name: ComboBox
info.comment: The ComboBox class manages the display and interaction of user combo boxes.

description.p: The ComboBox class is used to create combo boxes, also known as 'drop-down menus' in application interfaces. A combobox typically looks like a text entry area, but features a button positioned to the right-hand side of the gadget. Clicking on the button will pop-up a menu that the user can use to select a pre-defined menu item. Clicking on one of those items will paste the item text into the combobox.

A crucial feature of the combobox is the drop-down menu. The combobox uses the Menu class to support its menu construction. To add items to the drop-down menu, you need to pass instructions to it using XML. You can learn more about the XML specification in the Menu class manual.

When the user selects a combobox item, you may need to respond with an action. You can do this by initialising child objects to the combobox. These will be executed when the combobox is activated. When programming, you can also subscribe to the combobox's Activate action and write a customised response routine.
The id of the most recently selected menu item can be retrieved from the SelectedID field.
To make modifications to the menu after initialisation, read the Menu field and manipulate it directly.

action.name: Clear
action.comment: Clears the content of the combobox list box.

action.name: Enable
action.comment: Turns the combobox back on if it has previously been disabled.

action.name: Focus
action.comment: Sets the focus on the combobox.

action.name: Hide
action.comment: Removes the combobox from the display.

action.name: MoveToBack
action.comment: Moves the combobox behind its siblings.

action.name: MoveToFront
action.comment: Moves the combobox in front of its siblings.

action.name: Redimension
action.comment: Changes the size and position of the combobox.

action.name: Resize
action.comment: Alters the size of the combobox.

action.name: SetVar
action.comment: Arguments can be passed through to the combobox menu via unlisted fields.

field.name: Align
field.comment: Manages the alignment of a combobox surface within its container.

description.p: The position of a combobox object can be abstractly defined with alignment instructions by setting this field. The alignment feature takes precedence over values in coordinate fields such as X and Y.

field.name: Bottom
field.comment: The bottom coordinate of the combobox (Y + Height).

field.name: Disable
field.comment: Disables the combobox on initialisation.

description.p: The combobox can be disabled on initialisation by setting this field to TRUE. If you need to disable the combobox after it has been activated, it is preferred that you use the Disable action.
To enable the combobox after it has been disabled, use the Enable action.

field.name: Feedback
field.comment: Provides instant feedback when a user interacts with the Combobox.

description.p: Set the Feedback field with a callback function in order to receive instant feedback when user interaction occurs. The function prototype is routine(*ComboBox)

field.name: Flags
field.comment: Optional flags may be defined here.

field.name: Height
field.comment: Defines the height of the combobox.

description.p: An combobox can be given a fixed or relative height by setting this field to the desired value. To set a relative height, use the FD_PERCENT flag when setting the field.

field.name: Label
field.comment: The label is a string displayed to the left of the combobox area.

description.p: A label can be drawn next to the combobox area by setting the Label field. The label should be a short, descriptive string of one or two words. It is common practice for the label to be followed with a colon character.

field.name: LabelWidth
field.comment: A set-width for the label area of the combobox may be defined here.

description.p: If you set a label for the combobox, the width of the label area is automatically calculated according to the width of the label string. You may override this behaviour by setting a value in the LabelWidth field.

field.name: Menu
field.comment: Provides direct access to the drop-down menu.

description.p: The drop-down menu that is used for the combobox can be accessed directly through this field. You may find this useful for manipulating the content of the drop-down menu following initialisation of the combobox.

field.name: Region
field.comment: The surface that represents the combobox is referenced through this field.

description.p: The surface area that represents the combobox display can be accessed through this field. For further information, refer to the Surface class. Note that interfacing with the surface directly can have adverse effects on the combobox control system. Where possible, all communication should be limited to the combobox object itself.

field.name: Right
field.comment: The right-most coordinate of the combobox (X + Width).

field.name: SelectedID
field.comment: Returns the menu ID of the selected combobox item.

description.p: This field returns the menu ID of the selected combobox item. This requires that an id is set for each configured menu item (the 'id' attribute).
Menu ID's are not guaranteed to be unique. It is your responsibility to assign ID's and ensure that they are unique to prevent an ID from matching multiple items.
If the combobox text does not reflect one of the available menu items, then the returned value will be -1. If the selected menu item has no identifier, the default return value is 0.

field.name: String
field.comment: The string that is to be printed inside the combobox is declared here.

description.p: The string that you would like to be displayed in the combobox is specified in this field. The string must be in UTF-8 format and may not contain line feeds. You can read this field at any time to determine what the user has entered in the combobox.
If the string is changed after initialisation, the combobox will be redrawn to show the updated text. No feedback notification will be sent as a result of updating this field manually.

field.name: Surface
field.comment: The surface that will contain the combobox graphic.

description.p: The surface that will contain the combobox graphic is set here. If this field is not set prior to initialisation, the combobox will attempt to scan for the correct surface by analysing its parents until it finds a suitable candidate.

field.name: TabFocus
field.comment: Set this field to a TabFocus object to register the combobox in a tab-list.

description.p: The TabFocus field provides a convenient way of adding the combobox to a TabFocus object, so that it can be focussed on via the tab key. Simply set this field to the ID of the TabFocus object that is managing the tab-list for the application window.

field.name: TextInput
field.comment: The text control object created for the combobox is referenced here.

description.p: The text object that is referenced here manages the display and editing of text inside the combobox area. Characteristics of the text object can be defined prior to initialisation, although we recommend that this be done from the combobox style definition.
The face and point size of the text is set by the widget styling code and therefore cannot be changed through the TextInput object directly.

field.name: Width
field.comment: Defines the width of a combobox.

description.p: A combobox can be given a fixed or relative width by setting this field to the desired value. To set a relative width, use the FD_PERCENT flag when setting the field.

field.name: X
field.comment: The horizontal position of a combobox.

description.p: The horizontal position of a combobox can be set to an absolute or relative coordinate by writing a value to the X field. To set a relative/percentage based value, you must use the FD_PERCENT flag or the value will be interpreted as fixed. Negative values are permitted.

field.name: XOffset
field.comment: The horizontal offset of a combobox.

description.p: The XOffset has a dual purpose depending on whether or not it is set in conjunction with an X coordinate or a Width based field.

If set in conjunction with an X coordinate then the combobox will be drawn from that X coordinate up to the width of the container, minus the value given in the XOffset. This means that the width of the ComboBox is dynamically calculated in relation to the width of the container.
If the XOffset field is set in conjunction with a fixed or relative width then the combobox will be drawn at an X coordinate calculated from the formula X = ContainerWidth - ComboBoxWidth - XOffset.

field.name: Y
field.comment: The vertical position of a combobox.

description.p: The vertical position of a ComboBox can be set to an absolute or relative coordinate by writing a value to the Y field. To set a relative/percentage based value, you must use the FD_PERCENT flag or the value will be interpreted as fixed. Negative values are permitted.

field.name: YOffset
field.comment: The vertical offset of a combobox.

description.p: The YOffset has a dual purpose depending on whether or not it is set in conjunction with a Y coordinate or a Height based field.

If set in conjunction with a Y coordinate then the combobox will be drawn from that Y coordinate up to the height of the container, minus the value given in the YOffset. This means that the height of the combobox is dynamically calculated in relation to the height of the container.

If the YOffset field is set in conjunction with a fixed or relative height then the combobox will be drawn at a Y coordinate calculated from the formula Y = ContainerHeight - ComboBoxHeight - YOffset.

Synonym for FIXED_SIZE

If the dimensions of the original picture are smaller than the destination surface, the image will be stretched to fit. Enlargement is dynamic, so if the surface changes in size then the size of the picture will be recalculated to fit.

If the source image file does not exist or an error occurs during loading, the image object will still pass the initialisation process successfully. When the image object is drawn, it will clear the target surface to the colour specified in the Background field.

If the dimensions of the original picture are larger than the destination surface, the image will be stretched to fit. Shrinking is dynamic, so if the surface changes in size then the size of the picture will be recalculated to fit.
Synonym for NO_BLEND

This flag applies to image resizing. When set, the calculated width and height will be limited so that the image cannot be stretched beyond the edges of the target surface. This flag is commonly set in conjunction with the 11RATIO flag.
Turns off alpha-blending if the target surface has the COMPOSITE flag set and the source image has an alpha channel.

Image data will normally be stored at its original size and resized on the fly when the STRETCH flag is used. Setting the FIXED_SIZE flag will pre-scale the image and permanently store it at that size.
This flag conveniently combines the ENLARGE and SHRINK flags to ensure that the image always covers the dimensions of the destination surface.
The image source is scalable (e.g. vector graphic).
All calls to Move and MoveToPoint are ignored if this flag is set.
When resizing the image, the calculated width and height will always be in correct proportion relative to the source image's original width and height.
When in edit mode, this option helps the user by auto-completing text.
Enable edit mode, which allows the user to write free-text in the combobox.
Show icons in the dropdown list.
Disable on creation; or combobox is currently disabled.
Hide on creation, or combobox is currently hidden.
When in edit mode, limit-to-list prevents the user from entering text that isn't in the combobox list.
Do not translate combobox strings or the drop-down menu to the user's native language.
Raw information that is uncategorised can be defined as a data clip.
Pure file references are stored as file clips. This type is typically used by file managers for moving and copying files.
Plain text files such as ASCII and UTF-8 must be identified through this clip type.
An audio clip that is recognised by the Sound class (such as wav's and mp3's).
Images that are recognised by the Picture class may be stored as this type (such as jpeg's and png files).
An object that has been deserialised into binary form.
Hide the string characters for secret text entry (e.g. passwords).
Preserve-background disables fast scrolling for background preservation.
This read-only flag is set automatically when the user has selected an area of text.
Keeps the text object in edit mode regardless of user focus.
Enables text selection (with or without edit mode). If in line mode, a single click will allow the user to highlight any line.
This read-only flag is set if the object has been disabled through the Disable action.
Turns on overwrite mode (if off, insert mode is enabled).
Synonym for MULTI_SELECT | SINGLE_SELECT
Convert enter-key presses to the tab-key.
This flag forces the capitalisation of all text that is entered into the object.
Clears the text string when the enter key is pressed.
This flag must be enabled if the user is permitted to change the text string with the keyboard.
If the font is scalable, the text string will be resized to fit inside the surface that contains it (i.e. no characters will be clipped). This is acheived by recalculating the font's point size.
Enables word wrapping.
Automatically select all text if the text object receives the focus.
If the tab key is pressed, print the tab character.
Hide the string characters for secret text entry (e.g. passwords).
Allow the user to select/highlight multiple lines by holding the Ctrl key.

This flag forces a text object to recalculate any variable references in its string data whenever a redraw occurs. Such references are indicated through square brackets, e.g. [desktop.width]. Refer to the StrEvaluate() function in the Strings module for more information.
Translate strings to the user's native language.
Enables historical browsing when the up/down cursor keys are used. The number of historical lines stored can be set in the HistorySize field.
This flag is set by default to enable system key support. System-keys provide support for common key combinations such as Ctrl-C, Ctrl-X etc.
Enables a colour background behind the text.
Pressing the tab key is treated the same as pressing enter.
Synonym for AUTO_CLEAR | EDIT | HISTORY
Ensures that the scrollbar is always on display.
Enables relative scrolling (movement is reported relative to the current slider position rather than in absolute coordinates).
Hide on creation, or scrollbar is currently hidden.
If set, the scrollbar behaves as a slider. In this mode, the size of the draggable slider has a fixed size (by default the slider is proportional).
Do not attempt to intersect with adjacent scrollbars.

Tree mode can be used if the items are arranged in a hierarchy, where items can be embedded within items. The tree view provides small buttons that the user can click to expand the tree and view hidden items.

Document mode allows view data to be passed to a document object for display. You are required to provide a document object that is pre-loaded with a template capable of processing input from the view object. Refer to the Document field for more information.

This mode combines the column and tree modes. The view displays the layout and style of normal column mode, but the first column is used to display and manage a tree hierarchy. The tree can be expanded and collapsed just as in the standard tree mode.
